column4: i have 7 different things i can do with my mouse, i dont get how to implement these into xorg
i do have the CD which came with the mouse, but i dont think it would help, would it?
which mouse is it?
i am using a Dynex mouse
what model number?
how many buttons, etc
DX-WOM2
it has left/right clickers, a scroll thingy which can be clicked, and 2 side buttons which when on XP the left side one would go back and the right side one would go forward
run `xev`, a little white box will pop up; click all your mouse buttons in that area, and watch the output to see what buttons the system is detecting
i did and the window hasnt done anything
what if you changed it to "evdev" ?
did you run xev from a terminal?
ok now i see what you were saying, what now
it's usually best to run most commands from a terminal, in case they give useful output. in this case, xev only gives output in the terminal window
make sure you click every button and make sure they each register as something different... button 1 for left, 2 (or 3) for right and middle, and hopefully the side buttons get recognized as 4 and 5
yes, it seems as if all the buttons have been recognized
does the scroll wheel work?
currently, yes the scroll wheel operates correctly
can you view xorg.conf, and see what driver is mentioned in the mouse section?
yep, lemme get that for ya....." Driver         "mouse" "
do i need to do anything to get these settings to work?
restarting X will use the new settings in xorg.conf.. sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart will do this, but you'll be logged out, of course
